boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Vikings: Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
In the frigid Runic Isles of the North Sea, the Vikings reign supreme. These determined explorers navigate the icy fjords, build fertile settlements upon rocky crags, and fight for the glory of their clans with blood and steel. Only the Gods stand above them, and it is every Vikings’ dream to serve their God in the afterlife, Valhalla.

Tiny Epic Vikings is a fast playing 1-4 player strategy game of drafting, area control, and set collection.

In Tiny Epic Vikings, players lead a clan of Vikings over 3 eras, in hopes of claiming the icy lands for their own. They play Viking Cards that represent their clan’s leaders, choosing the best builders, harvesters, explorers, and warriors. Raid and conquer the islands with settlers, build boats and temples to gain influence, and battle for the favor of the gods!

The Shamans mini expansion brings new powerful leaders to your clan. They will enhance your runic favor and boost the god's fury like never before! Cairn tokens will encourage even more battling and will reward you bonuses on following actions for doing so. Beware though, Loki and Hel await to show off their tricky and treacherous powers!

listing.notes:
New PREORDER Deluxe bundle pledge
Final sale. KS delays expected

boardgame.name: Micro Bots: Power Up
boardgame.description: An expansion for Micro Bots: Duel, containing two new robots and Power Tokens with various additional effects.

boardgame.name: ¿Qué son los juegos de rol? Guía didáctica
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

¿Alguna vez te has preguntado qué es un juego de rol, o alguien te lo ha preguntado a ti? Cuando escuchas hablar a tus amigos sobre el tema, ¿no entiendes lo que dicen? ¿Te gustaría que tus compañeros de trabajo o tu familia te propusieran jugar una partida? ¿Piensas que los juegos de rol son unos desconocidos para la gran mayoría de las personas?

"¿Qué son los juegos de rol? Guía didáctica" es un libro escrito por Simón Blasco Perales que pretende, como su propio nombre indica, ejercer de vademécum en todo lo relacionado con los juegos de rol. En sus páginas podremos encontrar todos los fundamentos básicos y necesarios para iniciarse en los juegos de rol y comprender de qué tratan.

El objetivo por el cual ha sido concebido este libro no es otro que acercar los juegos de rol a los no iniciados en el tema y mostrar que se trata de un entretenimiento sano, lúdico y muy divertido. Aunque no por ello deja de lado a los jugadores experimentados que encontrarán entre sus páginas consejos, ambientaciones, sistemas o explicaciones que harán que su lectura sea enriquecedora a todos aquellos que decidan acercarse a esta obra.

boardgame.name: Treinta años de Aquelarre
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Treinta años de Aquelarre es una recopilación de artículos sobre el decano de los juegos de rol españoles escrito por aquellos que lo vivieron de primera mano. Los trece capítulos contienen las vivencias de su creador, Ricard Ibáñez, pero también de autores de diversos suplementos, ilustradores de las distintas encarnaciones del juego y editores. Estas páginas ofrecen todo tipo de reflexiones sobre las tres décadas que el juego de rol demoníaco-medieval lleva publicándose, con anécdotas que te descubrirán los entresijos de la producción de un juego de rol único.

boardgame.name: El Signo Amarillo
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Cuanto más fuerte es la luz, más fuerte es la sombra que proyecta... y en París, la ciudad de las luces, las tinieblas llevan tiempo conspirando para sumirla en la más terrible oscuridad...

El Signo amarillo es una aventura de Ratas en las paredes para 3-4 jugadores, ambientada en la época actual, donde los personajes son miembros de un grupo de investigadores afincado en París que investiga todo tipo de hechos paranormales.

Esta aventura no solo afectará al grupo profesionalmente, ya que la trama les implicará emocionalmente en los hechos narrados en ella.

Una investigación por asesinato, la búsqueda de un antiquísimo artefacto maldito, una trepidante persecución por unas decrépitas catacumbas, una mascarada cruel y un final épico e inesperado. Todo esto y mucho más te espera en El Signo Amarillo.

boardgame.name: Taste of China
boardgame.description:
Chinese culinary delights are within reach of your shopping basket. You will need to be fast and quick-sighted in order to bring some home. Ready, steady, go!

After all the tiles have been displayed, the first player turns a card showing an ingredient. The players have now to find the way of a single colour leading to the ingredient before the other players do.

boardgame.name: Adventures of Alice in Wonderland Game
boardgame.description:
This is a simple race game depicting Alice's fall down the rabbit hole, illustrated with black-and-white scenes from Paramount Pictures' "Alice in Wonderland" (1933), starring Charlotte Henry.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Balancing Act
boardgame.description:
Balancing Act is a quick playing card game where players are creating Circus Acts by playing a card from their hand and taking all the cards in the center row that are either higher valued or lower valued than that card they played. Those cards either go in their Acts creating sequential runs of cards or into their hands to be played later. Beware though you can only have so many Acts that score positive points and every card in your hand scores you negative points!

There are some special cards in the game:

The Elephant when played allows to you play a card from your hand to one of your Acts. This is the only way you can play a card from your hand.
The Zebra is a wild card and worth +1 point in your Acts, but prevents you from playing cards after it.
The Giraffe is wild as well, however it is -2 points.


The game ends when the deck of 54 cards runs out and whoever has the most points is the winner!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cartel Dice Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Cartel dice includes:
- 10 six sided dice
- Swirl of red & green
- White sugar skull located on the "1" face
Set the mood at your table with these colorful dice!

boardgame.name: Cartel Deck of Locations
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Deck of Locations is a supplement for Cartel featuring:
- 54 cards, each with a different location in Durango
- Full-color photo and description for each card
- Custom move written for each location
The Deck of Locations* contains more than fifty businesses, restaurants, and landmarks for use with Cartel, each featuring a vibrant image and unique move for that location. From police stations to taquerías, cable cars to archivos federales, the Deck of Locations offers new ways for players to stay ahead of their enemies when every moment counts.

boardgame.name: Cartel Map of Durango
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This Kickstarter exclusive Map of Durango features:
- 11"x17" map marked with useful locations in Durango
- Sturdy cloth material that won't fade or rip
This colorful 11"x17" cloth map is the perfect visual aide to kick off your dangerous delve into the world of the Sinaloa drug cartel. The map features numbered locations corresponding to the Deck of Locations, the map of Durango is based on the real city, infused with Cartel's unique style.

boardgame.name: Legacy of Maela: Alfred's Armory
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Armory!

Enrich your gameplay with these illustrations of weaponry, armor, & items found throughout the Legacy of Maela series. Provide a little extra for your players. In addition, Alfred provides a little extra for you.

This resource has 4 pages packed with illustrations of arms, armor, & other things. The rest of the book contains extras thanks to Alfred & the ideas that keep bubbling to the surface of his mind including new wondrous itmes, characters, & concepts.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Legacy of Maela: Battle for Ironhold
boardgame.description:
TM#5: Let the Battle Begin!

Introducing a new adventure for the world of Maela. Prepare to face off again against the infamous Lord Crowley! He's back, & this time with an army. Take on his mind-controlled minions, raid his personal stronghold, & finally put the traitor in the ground! Or die trying...
This module includes a complete adventure module, 5 pre-generated character sheets, & a scoring sheet. It is designed for 5-8 hours of gameplay.

Specifically designed for tournament play, this module can alternately be played to augment your own custom campaign. This module is part of the series of modules designed for the Legacy of Maela campaign world, the first of which appeared in Legacy of Maela: Catacombs.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Legacy of Maela: Blood Sporting
boardgame.description:
TM#4: Bloodsporting Anyone?...

Introducing a new adventure for the world of Maela. Prepare to face the challenges of the arena! You & your party have been falsely accused of murdering the hereditary king of Ortho. Now, you must fight to the death in the arena of the capital city of Gandil. Also, uncover an unanticipated secret that will put even more than your lives on the line!
This module includes a complete adventure module, 5 pre-generated character sheets, & a scoring sheet. It is designed for 8-10 hours of gameplay.

Specifically designed for tournament play, this module can alternately be played to augment your own custom campaign. This module is part of the series of modules designed for the Legacy of Maela campaign world, the first of which appeared in Legacy of Maela: Catacombs.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Legacy of Maela: Calming the Storm
boardgame.description:
Venture into the world of Maela...

Prepare to sail the treacherous seas, be framed for murder, get lost in mysterious swamps & jungles. face off in the gladiatorial arena, win a war, save a king, & free a city! This compilation contains 7 advenure modules designed for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game system (d20).
Contained within this compilation are the full modules from 7 Legacy of Maela adventure modules & the resource book:

* Misadventure of the Reject,
* Heart of Darkness,
* Death in the Family,
* Blood Sporting,
* Battle for Ironhold,
* Longnight,
* City of Rite & Wrong (all new!),
* Alfred's Armory.

In addition, Alfred has extras for you that remained unpublished until now including a couple campaign starters (one of which is out of this world), riddles, & other random bits. The modules herein were specifically designed for Great Game Day play. These modules introduce various regions & aspects of the Maelaen campaign world; however, they can alternately be played to augment your own custom campaign & settng. Enjoy!

Modified to be compatible with Paizo's Pathfinder, this book keeps all the Legacy of Maela rules that players loved! The material herein is compatible with any other d20 campaign setting.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Legacy of Maela: Catacombs
boardgame.description:
The Culmination is Within Reach... in 830 Pages of Awesome!
Welcome to the newest addition to the Legacy of Maela series! This d20 game expansion is specifically designed for Paizo's Pathfinder & is compatible with Dungeons & Dragons version 3.5.
Contained within this compendium are the full resources from all three Legacy of Maela books (Campaign Setting, Remote Regions, & Dreams & Darkness) as well as additional information that remained unpublished until now. Modified to be compatible with Paizo's Pathfinder, this book keeps all the Legacy of Maela rules that players loved! All new classes, prestige classes, feats, equipment, spells, & monsters are compatible with any other campaign setting.

Inside, you will find the following: 8 revised playable races, 7 revised base & 31 prestige classes, over 100 feats & 56 Legacy feats, a cadre of weaponry, armor, equipment, special materials, & magic items, 47 spells, rules & equipment for World War II era play, over 59 monsters, 20 legendary & many more NPCs, 18 campaign starts, & 2 full adventure modules.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Legacy of Maela: Death in the Family
boardgame.description:
TM#3: A Death in the Family...

Introducing a new adventure for the world of Maela. Prepare to face the challenges & intrigues of Ortho & its capital of Gandil. You & your party are hired to investigate the murder of the hereditary king of Ortho. You will encounter horrors as you delve down into the heart of Greenspire Castle in search of the traitor! This module includes a complete adventure module, 5 pre-generated character sheets, & a scoring sheet. It is designed for 6-8 hours of gameplay.

Specifically designed for tournament play, this module can alternately be played to augment your own custom campaign. This module is part of the series of modules designed for the Legacy of Maela campaign world, the first of which appeared in Legacy of Maela: Catacombs.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Legacy of Maela: Heart of Darkness
boardgame.description:
TM#2: Into the Heart of Darkness...

Introducing a new adventure for the world of Maela. Prepare to face the challenges of the Teka Jungles. Monsters & mayhem await as you & your party of fellow adventurers race to be the first to claim a secret treasure of the jungles--a massive ruby known as Yumo's Heart!

This module includes a complete adventure module, 5 pre-generated character sheets, & a scoring sheet. It is designed for 6-8 hours of gameplay.

Specifically designed for tournament play, this module can alternately be played to augment your own custom campaign. This module is part of the series of modules designed for the Legacy of Maela campaign world, the first of which appeared in Legacy of Maela: Catacombs.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Legacy of Maela: Dreams & Darkness
boardgame.description:
Weren't impressed with 4th edition? Try this d20 game expansion for Dungeons & Dragons version 3.5 & Pathfinder. As part of the Legacy of Maela series, this book delves into the stories that make up the world of Maela...

The experience continues with new challenges & encounters! Within this book, one will find 2 new base classes, 3 new prestige classes, new feats, new equipment, magic gear, & vehicles, variant combat rules & general rules for playing children in Maela & new characters, organizations, & monsters. Also included are over 15 Campaign Starters that contain plots, suggestions, characters galore, & scenarios. Use what you like for your game as either side-quests or full-blown campaigns! Lastly, this book contains bonus materials for futuristic campaigning!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Legacy of Maela: Longnight
boardgame.description:
TM#6: It's Going to be One Long Night...

Introducing a new adventure for the world of Maela. Prepare to get lost! You & your party may have bitten off a little more than you can chew. Swamps are dangerous places to traverse, especially at night, and especially when you're an unwelcomed guest! Can you rescues others lost in the fetid marshes without succumbing to them yourselves?
This module includes a complete adventure module and 5 pre-generated character sheets. It is designed for 6-8 hours of gameplay.

Specifically designed for Great Game Day play, this module can alternately be played to augment your own custom campaign. This module is part of the series of modules designed for the Legacy of Maela campaign world, the first of which appeared in Legacy of Maela: Catacombs.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Deck of Mysterious Creations (5E)
boardgame.description:
The Deck of Mysterious Creations is an accessory for use with Necromancer Games' Tome of Alchemy. It is not a standalone game; the deck is used to keep track of the vital essences and other ingredients available to alchemists. Included in this deck are:

50 Monters Cards (with statistics)
12 Gemstone Cards
15 Metal and Rare Earth Cards

For use with 5th Edition Rules

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Deck of Mysterious Creations (PF)
boardgame.description:
The Deck of Mysterious Creations is an accessory for use with Necromancer Games' Tome of Alchemy. It is not a standalone game; the deck is used to keep track of the vital essences and other ingredients available to alchemists. Included in this deck are:

50 Monters Cards (with statistics)
12 Gemstone Cards
15 Metal and Rare Earth Cards

For use with Pathfinder Rules

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Unmatched: Cobble & Fog – Foil Cards
boardgame.description: A pack of four foil cards: Dracula, Invisible Man, Sherlock Holmes, Jekyll & Hyde.

boardgame.name: The Lantern Issue One
boardgame.description:
The Lantern, issue 1, is a zine for the Four Against Darkness solo RPG.

Issue 1 includes:

Tumbarr, the Curse of the Unliving ones (adventure)
The Lair of the Four-Headed Hydra (adventure)
Four Against the Goblin King (adventure)
Den of the Man-Wolves (adventure)
The Sea King's Orcas (faction)
Two new monsters, 1 new spells and 4 new magic items.

The first print run included two personalized pages by Four Against Darkness creator Andrea Sfiligoi. One included an ink sketch and another a personalized rule that the owner of the zine is allowed to use in the game. These were different in every copy, so no two copies of the zine were exactly the same.

Reprints, without the custom drawn pages, are available on the web.

boardgame.name: House of Detention
boardgame.description:
User Summary

You wake up in a creepy gym locker room, only with a flashlight, and try to get out by finding meme scrolls and cups of "hot load" while monsters, including The Lash of the Spanking are attacking you.

A free DLC is available which includes nudity and BDSM equipment.

boardgame.name: The Lantern Issue Two
boardgame.description:
Lantern Issue 2 - a zine filled with adventures and playable materials for Four Against Darkness.

In issue two:

Watery Cave of the Witch (adventure)
The Origin of the Horned Owlbear (lore and stats)
The Mushroom Menace (adventure)
The Mists of Warunor (campaign)
The Uncharted Settlement (adventure)
Requires only the Four Against Darkness book.

boardgame.name: Furry Love
boardgame.description:
User Summary

24 levels of four styles arcade games which will give you a showreel of furry hentai.

The game types are a Pac-Man type, a JezzBall type, a Jones on Fire type and a jigsaw puzzle type.

The images are explicid.

boardgame.name: Furry Love 2
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Seven different game modes to be played - and over 56 levels to go through to see various (explicit) drawings of hentai furry ladies.

boardgame.name: Hex up!
boardgame.description:
Hex Up! is a game by Czech author Olda Rejl. It contains 6 different games that will bring you 6 game experiences.

Individual game variants:

Pack. Everyone plays at the same time, no matter the order. Players take hexes from the table, combine them on top of each other and layer them on top of the community deck in the rack. Each player's job is to quickly find a suitable hex, or suitably combine two hexes on top of each other in their hand and place it on the deck in the rack, suits up. The move cannot be corrected once it has been placed.

Land. Each player has their own topping deck of hexes (face down in front of them), with 3 hexes laid out face up in front of them, and an initial supply of chips. Players regularly rotate their turns clockwise. On a turn, a player selects two of his three hexes and combines them to form a hex up, which he places on the table so that it matches the adjacent colours on all sides where it is adjacent to those previously laid out. The player may immediately complete his turn by placing a coloured chip on the hole. Immediately after the turn, the player counts the points that this turn has brought him and takes the corresponding number of coins. The player then takes the hexes from his top-up deck and plays the next player. Once all players have run out of their reload pack and their unloaded supply of hexes, the game ends and the player with the most coins wins.

Speed. Each player creates their own top-up deck from their hexes, and places it face down in front of them. On command, the players simultaneously turn over a given number of hexes and try to assess which of the six suits are missing from the face-up cards and collect the coins of those suits from the table as quickly as possible. The game ends when all players have run out of hexes in the replenishment deck. The player with the most coins wins.

Bluff: The object of the game is to get as many coins as possible by collecting all suits in a player's hand. The player can also bluff. Coins can also be obtained by revealing an opponent's bluff attempt. The player who has the turn takes a hex card from the menu and places it in his palm. He then turns over the top hex of the topping deck and completes the bid to a count of three. Players take turns. The next hexes are layered in the player's hand on top of the hexes from the previous rounds, so that they are hexagonal in shape, with the aim of making a six of different suits. If a player's addition of the current hex results in a combination of six visible different colors, he or she announces this clearly to his or her opponents by saying the word "Color!" and takes 1 coin from the pot. He can also bluff. If any of the opposing players suspect that a player is bluffing, he immediately calls that player's bluff by saying "Bluff!", and he must show the hexes in his hand. A player can only be challenged until the next player takes a hex from the menu. If the challenged player has not bluffed, the challenger gives one coin to the challenged player. If the challenged player has bluffed, he/she gives the challenger the coin that was wrongly captured. The game ends when the hexes in both the top-up packet and the bidding run out. The player with the most coins at the end of the game wins.

Think. The solving team closes their eyes, the entering team stacks the assignment on the table. On command, the solving team looks at the table and views the assignment for 1 minute. When the time limit expires, the solving team closes its eyes again, the assigning team takes a base card and covers one of the assignments with it. They may not change the position or layout of the assignment on the table in any way. The solving team then looks at the table, where everything is as before, except that one of the assignments is covered by the back of the base card. The team's task is to identify which suits and in which positions are hidden on the covered assignment by placing the corresponding chips around the card. Once they have exhausted all the chips, the entering team picks up the base card and compares the chips laid out around it with the colors on the assignment. The solving team gets as many coins as they hit the correct colors and holes. In the next round, the teams' roles are reversed. The team with the most coins after six rounds wins.

Code: The object of the game is to get as many coins as possible, which a player gets whenever his personal color combination appears on the deck. Each player secretly draws 3 chips (their personal code).From the shuffled deck of hexes, each player takes 3 cards in their hand at the start of the game. Players take turns to play the cards in a clockwise direction. Each player plays his turn by placing a hex on the pile in the rack, face up. and recharges a new one from the recharge deck. When a player's color code appears on the cards in the rack, that player announces it by saying "Code!" and takes 1 coin (players do not check each other for accuracy and therefore may not cheat). A player may conceal the presence of the code on the board and not take the coin (e.g. if he thinks that by getting the coin his opponent would identify his code). The game ends when all players run out of hexes both in the recharge deck and in their hand. The player with the most coins wins.

boardgame.name: Kyodaina: Combat
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Combat with both Kyodainan Rooks and Imperial Soldiers is now upon you! This module outlines what is different about fighting the Rooks of Kyodaina and also what sort of threat the Imperial Soldiers represent for your general adventuring!

boardgame.name: Secret Order
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the real power that rules the world. Filled with ambitious members, our Secret Order all manoeuvre and connive our way to the highest echelons of humanity. By dominating the five key realms of society we impose our will upon the world.

In Secret Order you all have your own agenda. These power struggles are represented by the gathering of favour tiles. Each favour represents a weapon of manipulation to be used in the subjugation of the realms of society. Using the right power in the right market in integral to achieving your ultimate goal.

As with any behind the scenes machinations, it is unwise to reveal every tool at your disposal. Secret Order is no different. So when playing "The Game" you have tiles in the open for all to see but you also have your hidden agenda, secreted away until the time is right to strike!

Gather favour tiles, spend them to use your powers to disrupt your opponent's plans, hide them away until the time is right or collect the entire set of your desire to achieve victory and domination.

Secret Order is a fast paced game of hidden motives, power plays and ambition that will have you playing again and again.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: BALL American Football Board Game
boardgame.description:
BALL is a turn-based board game for two players. Both the aesthetics of the game and the rules are inspired by American football. The main objective of the game is to score a touchdown. Luck, elements of randomness or chance do not intervene in the game. Strategy is everything. Concentration, foresight and the development of game tactics are the key.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Das Rhön-Spiel
boardgame.description:
The game is a mixture between dice game and quiz game set in a German area named 'Rhön'.

The game was conceived with the idea of getting to know the natural beauty and sights of the Hessian-Bavarian-Thuringian low mountain range Rhön.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Ashfall
boardgame.description:
Ashfall is a 1-4 player deck building sci-fi RPG – take control of a powerful unique character, recruit unique allies and fill your deck with powerful actions – level up and customize your character from a wide range of unique abilities and perks. Explore diverse terrains from deserts to mysterious alien facilities and make use of Pelagium – a dangerous new resource. Play through the epic cooperative campaign, a deep character and narrative driven campaign and then play skirmish scenarios (both competitive and cooperative).

The Core Lands Protectorate (CLP), an expansionist state based on the southern two continents in the world, has for the past 40 years slowly absorbed all neighboring nations. With its vast military and centralized leadership, the CLP has faced little organized opposition. Major Mak Yarrym and his group of special operations solders is sent to deal with the latest uprising in Artusa, a recently conquered nation. There, he discovers disturbing evidence that threatens to destabilize the uneasy peace between it and the YU…

The Yarangan Union (YU) is a scientifically advanced nation based in the northern archipelagos, with unmatched naval power - fleets of advanced self-sufficient ships known as Umiaqs powered by Pelagium (a rare and powerful resource). In the past several decades the YU’s Pelagium research has rapidly advanced under the supervision of Toerwahn Tijksyn. With his recent disappearance, research has stalled. His daughter, Mira Tijksyn, is sent on an expedition escorted by members of the secretive YU Security bureau. There, she begins to understand the source of her father’s discoveries.

As players, take on the role of characters on both sides of the developing conflict and together uncover a vast conspiracy that threatens to bring the world into a devastating war that could destroy both nations, or worse.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Buffet des Monstres
La comilona de los Monstruos
Hongerige Monsters
Monster Munch
Mostri golosoni
Schlemmermonster
怪物美食家
몬스터 뷔페
boardgame.description:
Flip over as many serving dishes as possible to fill your monster quickly, but be careful! Mixed among the delicacies are some foods that the monsters don't like at all! You'll have to remember where they are. The first player to reach the end of the buffet and get back again wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Monopoly Magyarország
boardgame.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Hungary.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Local de Ensayo
boardgame.description:
It's your time, now you can become the author you've always wanted and set up the group you've always dreamed of for the next COAC (Cadiz's Carnival Contest). But be careful, the rest of the authors will have their mission, to annoy you and to lead a better group than yours.

This card driven game lets you get a band together to compete in Cadiz's (Spain) most prestigious contest.

This is a filler game for anyone who wants to dare to put together a group for the next COAC. You can play from 2 to 6 players and being 7 years old is enough to be able to join the game, which will last between 15 and 30 minutes.

boardgame.name: とりてこ (Torite Co)
boardgame.description:
Torite Co (Trick Taking by Coffee Ritokon Blend) is a must-follow team-based trick taking game where the goal is to brew as much coffee as possible because your wage depends on it!

The setting is a popular cafe, and the players divide into two teams to brew coffee. Brewing more coffee than the opposing team is the winning condition of this game.

In Torite Co, players will always be divided into two teams. If you play with 4 or more people, you may not know know who your teammate is (due to identity concealment).

Therefore, you can unintentionally help the opposing team, or there may also be situations where teammates drag each other down.

In addition to the identity concealment element, in the case of 4 and 5 players, it can be an irregular team structure (1 to 3 or 2 to 3). If it becomes one-on-three, it may be difficult to win on one side, but the sense of accomplishment when you win will be higher than when you win 2 vs 2…

—description from the publisher (translated)

The 3 main wrinkles of this game:

The secret teammate component is similar to Doppelkopf where the “part-time leader” calls out a specific card to indicate that the player with that card is now on their team (this player does not have to reveal who they are). The leader also chooses the Trump suit for the round.

Tricks can be worthless or count for multiple points, as only Coffee Cards (8-A) count for points.

2 is considered the highest number (still lower than A and T) when the trick is entirely comprised of the same suit.

boardgame.name: Fort Jefferson Attack
boardgame.description: The Fort Jefferson Attack game is a low to moderate complexity tactical game covering the Chickasaw attack on Fort Jefferson during the American Revolutionary War. The game takes about 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Americans and their allies, and the other player commands the Chickasaws.

boardgame.name: Battle of Baton Rouge
boardgame.description: The Battle of Baton Rouge is a low to moderate complexity tactical game covering the Spanish attack against the British redoubt at Baton Rouge in 1779 during the American Revolutionary War. The game takes 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Spanish forces and the other player commands the British forces.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
